author: MSNBC.com
title: Ahead of New Hampshire, Klobuchar and Biden stand by criticism of Buttigieg
description: Ahead of Tuesday's primary election in New Hampshire, Senator Amy Klobuchar and fmr. Vice President Joe Biden stood by their attacks on fmr. South Bend Mayor Pete Buttigieg's experience levels. NBC's Priscilla Thompson and Amanda Golden report.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: California pardons gay civil rights activist
description: In his final thoughts, Rev. Al Sharpton recalls his association with Bayard Rustin, the gay civil rights activist who was recently posthumously pardoned by California Governor Gavin Newsom.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: De Blasio decries officers shot in 'assassination' attempt; suspect arrested
description: Two New York City police officers were shot within hours of one another on Saturday night and Sunday morning in what officials believe were targeted attacks by the same suspect. The gunman who opened fire in the headquarters was reportedly taken into custody …

author: MSNBC.com
title: Why are qualified women Dems lagging in 2020 polls?
description: Elizabeth Warren and Amy Klobuchar lag far behind Bernie Sanders and Pete Buttigieg in the Democratic race for the 2020 presidential nomination. Are these women candidates being overlooked? Joy Reid and her panel discuss the ‘likeability’ critique often appli…
source.name: MSNBC

title: What Rev. Al Sharpton really thinks about Rush Limbaugh
description: In this week's Memo to Trump, Rev. Al Sharpton shares his disdain about racist radio personality Rush Limbaugh, the newest recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: How Democrats might compete with Trump’s showbiz sensibility
description: Donald Trump treated the State of the Union like a scripted reality TV show many experts say. How might Democrats compete with the president’s effective show business sensibility? Joy Reid and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Who will win big at the Oscars?
description: Ahead of tonight's 92nd Academy Awards, Alex Witt and Deadline Senior Editor Dominic Patten preview the major awards, with Patten giving his picks for who will bring home an Oscar.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: New Hampshire voters asked: How will get Democratic nomination?
description: New Hampshire and other voters are asked: How will get the 2020 Democratic presidential nomination? Watch Joy Reid get their answers live from a restaurant in New Hampshire, two days ahead of the New Hampshire primary.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Who Won the Week? ‘Nancy the Ripper’ and more winners in politics

title: Sanders campaign manager: ‘Trump is a corporate socialist’

title: Sen. Sherrod Brown: Trump is only getting more emboldened

author: MSNBC.com
title: Allen: Klobuchar is 'ride or die in a bar brawl'
description: NBCNews.com Reporter Jonathan Allen joins Chris Jansing to discuss Sen. Amy Klobuchar's performance in the final debate before the New Hampshire primary, where she demonstrated a trait that Democratic voters look for in a candidate - fight.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Fouhy: 'People are very eager to vote against Donald Trump'
description: Senior Politics Editor Beth Fouhy discusses why so many Democratic voters are so eager to vote against Pres. Donald Trump, but still undecided on which candidate they'll be voting for.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Maloney on GOP senators acquitting Trump: 'Phony friends are worse than honest enemies'
description: Rep. Sean Patrick Maloney discusses the firing of Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman, whom Maloney questioned during President Donald Trump's impeachment hearings. Evoking Vindman's testinmony, Maloney asks "does right matter?"

title: IA caucus turmoil casts scrutiny on early voting states
description: MSNBC national security analyst Clint Watts joins Ali Velshi to discuss concerns with the security surrounding the election process.

title: Weld on being the last Republican standing against Trump
description: Republican presidential candidate Bill Weld discusses being the last man standing against Donald Trump and the nomination.

title: Fmr. Rep. Katie Hill: 'No matter who the nominee is we have to rally behind them'
description: Fmr. Rep. Katie Hill joins Alex Witt to discuss party unity for the Democratic Party ahead of the New Hampshire primary.

title: Velshi: The trillion little pieces that'll be left behind to future generations
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi discusses debt and the “trillion little pieces” that’ll be left behind to future generations after the Trump administration.

title: Biden vs. Buttigieg leads to dispute of support among mayors
description:
The fight between Democratic presidential candidates Joe Biden and Pete Buttigieg is heating up and both are getting support from mayors across the country. 
MSNBC’s Ali Velshi talks to Cincinnati Mayor John Cranley, a Buttigieg backer and Mayor James Diossa …

title: Couple hosting presidential candidates: ‘They call us, we don’t call them’
